thread.title: UGA backup Hunter Long at the ready again while Brandon Kublanow banged up
thread.title_full: UGA backup Hunter Long at the ready again while Brandon Kublanow banged up

author: Marc Weiszer
title: UGA backup Hunter Long at the ready again while Brandon Kublanow banged up
text:
UGA backup Hunter Long at the ready again while Brandon Kublanow banged up 
Georgia starting center Brandon Kublanow practiced on a limited basis Monday while dealing with an ankle injury, according to Hunter Long, his backup. 
“In my mind, it’s the same thing, I prepare to be the starter every week,” said Long, who came in for Kublanow in the third quarter of the loss to Alabama and played the entire fourth quarter. “Whether (assistant Rob Sale) tells me to go in or not, that’s what I do. Basically, I’m going to keep preparing like I have been and however it is Saturday, that’s what I’m going to do.” 
Long is a fifth-year senior from Memphis who will return to his home state for Saturday’s game at Tennessee. 
“They were kind of from the far end,” said Long, who grew up closer to Ole Miss. “I never really liked orange.” 
Long said he graded out “pretty good,” against Alabama. He was in the game on Nick Chubb’s 83-yard touchdown run.
